info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 3:02PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Warren and northwestern Washington Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 302 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Johnsburg, or 9 miles west of Warrensburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warrensburg, Johnsburg, Hague, Rogers Rock Campground, Eagle Point Campground, Scaroon Manor Public Campground, Chestertown, Bolton Landing, Huletts Landing, Putnam, Bolton, Wright, Thurman, Stony Creek, Thurman Station, Sodom, Chipman Point, Starbuckville, Edwards Hill and Wevertown. This includes Interstate 87 between exits 24 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for east central New York.
